item.title: Waymo suspends service in San Francisco as robotaxis stall during blackout
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Waymo suspended its SF robotaxi service on Saturday evening after a massive blackout appeared to leave many of its vehicles stalled on city streets.

item.title: OpenAI allows users to directly adjust ChatGPT’s enthusiasm level
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: ChatGPT users can now tweak the chatbot’s warmth, enthusiasm, and emoji use.

item.title: New York Governor Kathy Hochul signs RAISE Act to regulate AI safety
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The bill will require large AI developers to publish information about their safety protocols and report safety incidents to the state within 72 hours.

item.title: Ex-Splunk execs’ startup Resolve AI hits $1 billion valuation with Series A
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The round was led by Lightspeed Venture Partners, according to people familiar with the deal.

item.title: Cursor continues acquisition spree with Graphite deal
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Graphite is an AI code review assistant that was last valued at $290 million.

item.title: Yann LeCun confirms his new ‘world model’ startup, reportedly seeks $5B+ valuation
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Renowned AI scientist Yann LeCun confirmed on Thursday the worst-kept secret in the tech world: that he had indeed launched a new startup. Although he did say he will not be running the new company as its CEO.

item.title: Hardware’s brutal week: iRobot, Luminar, and Rad Power go bankrupt
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo, Anthony Ha, Rebecca Bellan, Sean O'Kane
item.description: The hardware world had a brutal week, with iRobot, Luminar, and Rad Power Bikes all filing for bankruptcy.  Each company faces its own mix of tariff pressures, supply chain issues, and shifting markets, but together they tell a larger story about the challenges of building physical products in an era of global trade tensions and […]

item.title: OpenAI adds new teen safety rules to ChatGPT as lawmakers weigh AI standards for minors
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: OpenAI updated its guidelines for how its AI models should behave with users under 18, and published new AI literacy resources for teens and parents. Still, questions remain about how well policies translate into practice.

item.title: Known uses voice AI to help you go on more in-person dates
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: In its test phase in San Francisco, Known said it observed 80% of its introductions led to physical dates, which is much higher than swipe-based dating apps.

item.title: Meta is developing a new image and video model for a 2026 release, report says
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Meta aims to make the text-based model better at coding while also exploring new world models that understand visual information and can reason, plan, and act without needing to be trained on every possibility.

item.title: OpenAI is reportedly trying to raise $100B at an $830B valuation
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: The ChatGPT maker is aiming to raise the funding by the end of the first quarter in 2026, and the company may ask sovereign wealth funds to invest in the round.

item.title: From Roombas to e-bikes, why are hardware startups going bankrupt?
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: The hardware world had a brutal week, with iRobot, Luminar, and Rad Power Bikes all filing for bankruptcy.  Each company faces its own mix of tariff pressures, supply chain issues, and shifting markets, but together they tell a larger story about the challenges of building physical products in an era of global trade tensions and cheap overseas competition. From […]

item.title: ChatGPT launches an app store, lets developers know it’s open for business
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: OpenAI is looking to populate its flagship chatbot with a host of new user experiences.

item.title: Pickle Robot adds Tesla veteran as first CFO
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Jeff Evanson recently joined Pickle Robot as the company's first CFO as the startup has allegedly expanded its partnership with UPS.

item.title: Why British politicians are flocking to American tech giants
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Former British Chancellor of the Exchequer George Osborne has joined OpenAI as managing director and head of OpenAI for Countries. He also will run Coinbase's internal advisory council.

item.title: ChatGPT’s mobile app hits new milestone of $3B in consumer spending
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: ChatGPT has reached $3B in lifetime mobile consumer spending in just 31 months, faster than TikTok and major streaming apps.

item.title: Peripheral Labs taps into self-driving car sensors to bring sports fans right into the game
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: The startup has raised a $3.6 million seed round led by Khosla Ventures.

item.title: Luma releases a new AI model that lets users generate a video from a start and end frame
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Luma AI's new model is available through the company's Dream Machine platform.

item.title: Vibe-coding startup Lovable raises $330M at a $6.6B valuation
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Lovable has seen its valuation more than triple just five months after the company's last funding round in July.

item.title: Amazon’s new Alexa+ feature adds conversational AI to Ring doorbells
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Amazon said that the feature uses the Ring doorbell's video descriptions to determine who the person in front of the camera is based on their uniform, actions, and what they are holding.
